item.title: Josh add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Josh add a quote by Lowell Bennion
item.description: "Learn to like what doesn't cost much. Learn to like reading, conversation, music. Learn to like plain food, plain service, plain cooking. Learn to like fields, trees, brooks, hiking, rowing, climbing hills. Learn to like people, even though some of them may be different...different from you. Learn to like to work and enjoy the satisfaction doing your job as well as it can be done. Learn to like the song of birds, the companionship of dogs. Learn to like gardening, puttering around the house, and fixing things. Learn to like the sunrise and sunset, the beating of rain on the roof and windows, and the gentle fall of snow on a winter day. Learn to keep your wants simple and refuse to be controlled by the likes and dislikes of others." -- Lowell Bennion

item.title: Josh add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?" -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Josh add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Every day we're told that we live in the greatest country on earth. And it's always stated as an undeniable fact: Leos are born between July 23 and August 22, fitted queen-size sheets measure sixty by eighty inches, and America is the greatest country on earth. Having grown up with this in our ears, it's startling to realize that other countries have nationalistic slogans of their own, none of which are 'We're number two!" -- David Sedaris

item.title: Josh add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "I'd tried to straighten him out, but there's only so much you can do for a person who thinks Auschwitz is a brand of beer." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Josh add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "There was nothing but land; not a country at all, but the material out of which countries are made." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Josh add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "â€ŽThe idea of you is a part of my mind; you influence my likes and dislikes, all my tastes, hundereds of times when I dont realize it. You really are a part of me." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Josh add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Along with the idea of romantic love, she was introduced to another--physical beauty. Probably the most destructive ideas in the history of human thought. Both originated in envy, thrived in insecurity, and ended in disillusion." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Josh add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Whenever my environment had failed to support or nourish me, I had clutched at books..." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Josh add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "People don't talk like this, theytalklikethis. Syllables, words, sentences run together like a watercolor left in the rain. To understand what anyone is saying to us we must separate these noises into words and the words into sentences so that we might in our turn issue a stream of mixed sounds in response. If what we say is suitably apt and amusing, the listener will show his delight by emitting a series of uncontrolled high-pitched noises, accompanied by sharp intakes of breath of the sort normally associated with a seizure or heart failure. And by these means we converse. Talking, when you think about it, is a very strange business indeed." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Josh add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "The only way we know it's true is that we both dreamed it. That's what reality is. It's a dream everyone has together." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Josh add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Everybody else is working to change, persuade, tempt and control them. The best readers come to fiction to be free of all that noise." -- Philip Roth

item.title: Josh add a quote by Bill Clinton
item.description: "There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America." -- Bill Clinton

item.title: Josh add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Not one of your pertinent ancestors was squashed, devoured, drowned, starved, stranded, stuck fast, untimely wounded, or otherwise deflected from its life's quest of delivering a tiny charge of genetic material to the right partner at the right moment in order to perpetuate the only possible sequence of hereditary combinations that could result -- eventually, astoundingly, and all too briefly -- in you." -- Bill Bryson
